item.title: Finance concepts
item.description: Bonds$A$ (bondholder) buys a bond from $B$ (bond issuer) at a price, which is always fluctuating. After a set time, the maturity, $T$, $B$ will pay back $A$ a set amount, the face value, $F$. Before maturiy, $B$ may pay $A$ annually or semi-annually some percentage of the face value, and the percentage is the coupon rate, which can be 0 for short bonds.
